description: From Latin rīvālis (literally “person using the same stream as another”), from rīvus (“small stream, brook”).

entries.meaning: Having the same pretensions or claims; standing in competition for superiority.
examples: rival lovers; rival claims or pretensions

entries.meaning: A competitor (person, team, company, etc.) with the same goal as another, or striving to attain the same thing. Defeating a rival may be a primary or necessary goal of a competitor.
examples: Chris is my biggest rival in the 400-metre race.

entries.meaning: Someone or something with similar claims of quality or distinction as another.
examples: As a social historian, he has no rival.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) One having a common right or privilege with another; a partner.

verbs.description: rival (third-person singular simple present rivals, present participle rivalling or rivaling, simple past and past participle rivalled or rivaled)

entries.meaning: To be equal to, or match, or to surpass another.
To strive to equal or excel; to emulate.
examples: to rival thunder in its rapid course
